page.title: 11Ducklington Mill/Grain Store
page.content: This large development is built on the site of one of the old water mills on the edge of Ducklington. Originally the River Windrush powered the mill for the fulling process for the local woollen industry and then was converted to corn milling. More recently it has produced animal feeds. On the same site as the mill, huge grain stores have been built recently. These vast stores hold 38,000 tonnes of surplus grain. There is much annoyance with the local council for allowing the building of such a large industrial site in a rural area, on the edge of a village where it would be impossible to get permission to build a house. There is even more controversy about storing so much grain in this country whilst millions of people are starving because of widespread famine in Ethiopia and much of Central Africa
